 this format defines the format returned on a load a load returns the 32/36-bits in memory, plus xxor = even_parity(dat<35:0>) typically, dat<35> = parity(dat<34:0>), so the xor bit directly indicates parity error Note that the data field size is 36 bits on the 36XX/38XX, and 32 bits on the 31XX

struct cn38xx_par_struct spar

Detailed Description

This structure defines the data format in the low-latency memory.

Field Documentation

struct { ... } cvmx_llm_data_t::cn31xx

this format defines the format returned on a load a load returns the 32/36-bits in memory, plus xxor = even_parity(dat<35:0>) typically, dat<35> = parity(dat<34:0>), so the xor bit directly indicates parity error Note that the data field size is 36 bits on the 36XX/38XX, and 32 bits on the 31XX

struct cvmx_llm_data_t::cn31xx_par_struct cvmx_llm_data_t::cn31xx_par

This format defines what should be used if parity is desired.

Hardware returns the XOR of all the bits in the 36/32 bit data word, so for parity software must use one of the data field bits as a parity bit.
